education.degree: B.S. in Mechanical Engineering (Concentration in Robotics and Controls)

experience.details: Developing custom tactile sensors for dexterous hands

experience.position: Research Engineer with Prof. Kevin Lynch
experience.details: Designed custom biomimetic 5-bar torsional spring compliant power-grasping finger for robot hand lifting 20 lbs. Machined high-tolerance small-scale biomimetic robot finger parts. Optimized design of workspace through forward and backward kinematics calculations using jacobian matrices and simulation.

Grew to $75K ARR. Designed, built, and manufactured a fully-custom production-ready autonomous mobile robot engineered in Onshape; integrated COTS actuators, ESCs, MCUs, sensors. Developed low-level C++ firmware for real-time ESC and sensor interfacing, enabling precise closed-loop motor control and synchronized data acquisition at sub-millisecond latency.

Write a new embedded C++ closed loop control algorithm for ion thrusters. Validate through custom fluid physics simulations for SIL tests and propulsion hotfires to ensure robust in-space performance. Assist in launch operations of 4 new spacecraft for guidance navigation and controls.

Developed and validated proprietary vehicle crash detection algorithms to enhance the safety of 5 million vehicles through OTA updates. Engineered new electromechanical hardware-in-the-loop testers for IMUs, pressure sensors, and airbag algorithms for robotaxi.

Investigating conditional variational autoencoder (CVAE) for learning real-time robot dynamics and gait analysis, used PyTorch to develop models from scratch, tuned hyperparameters, and validated through OpenAI MuJoCo simulations on AntV3. Conceptualize and implement novel use of contrastive learning with CVAE's KL divergence loss function to more effectively characterize latent space of robot gaits.

Lead developer on $500,000 NSF project to integrate computer vision with a VR-controlled dexterous robot testbed with robotic hands. Built a 6D pose estimation pipeline with PyTorch and ROS2 allowing real-time inferencing with a fisheye camera and VR headset.

Developed physics-based computer vision molecule tracking algorithms for video analysis in Python and MATLAB, using spatial-temporal filtering and image processing techniques (median filtering and alpha shape thresholding) for the Bosch DNA image analysis project.

Co-authored peer-reviewed journal paper with Michelin Tires, published in the ASME Journal of Mechanical Design and presented at the ASME International Design Engineering Technical Conference (IDETC, 2024) to over 1000 industry engineers. Helped develop a digital twin model for vehicle tires to predict and optimize tire degradation, leading to reduced environmental waste for Michelin's fleet of 13 million trucks.

Designed and engineered robotic carriage for burrito bowl robot makeline, helping company secure a $20 million partnership with Chipotle's R&D robot kitchen to help meet customer requirements. Redesigned improved robotic component to pivot manufacturing plan for hardware scalability, reduced costs by negotiating with motor supplier, and designed for injection molding.

Researched and engineered an OpenCV pipeline to test quadcopter drone landing safety, implementing obstacle avoidance visual odometry and integrating in-house satellite-based mapping library. Presented results to FAA, providing direction for 'highway in the sky' regulatory framework based on live testing at Moffett Field.

design.details: Responsible engineer for design and analysis of front uprights and anti-roll bar suspension components to optimize handling, durability, and weight efficiency for Formula electric racing vehicle. Built first-principles mathematical models of suspension dynamics to predict kinematic and compliance behavior, informing geometry and material selection.

design.position: Corporate Outreach Chair and Simulations Engineer
design.details: Conducted Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations to analyze aerodynamic performance and optimize the nose cone shape for stability and drag reduction during flight. Performed Finite Element Analysis (FEA) on critical structural components like fin clamps to assess stress distribution during impact, safety factors, and material fatigue for a rocket designed to reach a 5,000 ft apogee launched in Huntsville, AL.

awards: Midwest Robotics Workshop (2024) — Generative AI for Robotic Gait Walking
ASME IDETC '24 (Washington DC) Best Paper Finalist
NSF/ASME Essay Grant Winner ($1500, Washington DC)
